result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendy L Monigold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendy L Monigold

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 a.m. Defendant Wendy L Monigold appeared by phone. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM514 and 13CT402.
Attorney  Ryan Drengler in court for Defendant Wendy L Monigold.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM514 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:***
15CM514: Bail Jump
$500 + costs + surcharges = $1083.00 
60 days to pay or set up plan

BTC: 13CT402 OAR is dismissed
fax letter from B.M.B. statement on behalf of defendant
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 7, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wendy L Monigold NOT in court with attorney Ryan Drengler.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM514 - Adjourned Initial Appearance, 13CT401 and 13CT402 - Motion to Revoke Bond.

8:36 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins makes statements that the defendant failed to appear on 12/21/15 so the IA was re-scheduled to today's date to accomodate the defendant and defendant has failed to appear for today's date.
Atty Cousins makes additional statements.
Atty Drengler makes statements as to why his client is not in court today and makes argument that she has no transportation as she lives approx. 2 hrs away.
Atty Drengler indicates that his client will be providing medical documentation.

BY THE COURT:
Motion Revoking Bond on 13CT401 and 13CT402 is GRANTED.
Bench Warrant Authorized - Body Only for 13CT401 and 13CT402.

15CM514:
Atty Cousins requests a bench warrant.
Atty Drengler states that he has an authorization to appear on behalf of his client.
No bench warrant to be authorized.
Defendant not in Court/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.

BY THE COURT:
Court enters Not Guilty Pleas on behalf of the defendant and PTC set for 15CM514 only.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:52 p.m. Defendant Wendy L Monigold not in court. Atty Drengler is present. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drengler states reasons for Defendant not being present today and request to adjourn so Defendant can make arrangements.  ADA Constable requests matter be rescheduled to 12-22-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
